WorkItem.Description:
Way to reproduce bug:
1) Open 2 instances of Rawr. (I use one for tank gear in bear form, and one for dps gear in kitty form). Do the rest of the steps in one of the Rawr instances.
2) Tools->Edit Items...->Add. Enter an item id and press ok.
3) An error message is displayed that it can't lock some file. Graceful enough. However, the error message asks me to copy/paste the message in an email to someone, but the message box doesn't support selecting the text. Only possible to make a screen dump. The Message box should be changed to support copy/paste of the error message.
4) I get an option to create a blank item and fill out the values myself. I select "No" and press ok. 
5) Rawr crashes due to an unhandled exception. Ungraceful and ugly. Should be handled. The error (standard .NET unhandled exception error) is copy/pasted below:

WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Crash when adding new item with multiple Rawrs open

Comments.Message:
Follow up on this:

After experiencing the previous error, trying to close the second instance of Rawr produces an error as well, since the config-file is changed. Very ungracefully, the user needs to click away several errors before the application shuts down.

Further issue:

Rawr seems to store all data in the folder it was installed into. This poses a big problem when several users on the same computer uses Rawr at the same time. The above error occured even when I closed all my Rawr instances save for one, and then I noticed Rawr running in another Wildows login session... Shutting down all Rawr in other sessions solved the issue for me.
Rawr is specifically designed to NOT run more than one copy at a time. If you want multiple instances of Rawr, please duplicate the whole folder.
Fixed issue allowing multiple instances when running in release mode.
The mutex was changed to prevent a second instance from opening of the same copy.  If you create a second copy of the folder and run a second instance from there, it will work correctly.

This change created problems for me. When I now try to start Rawr I get the following error log:
